intro: Henriettella fascicularis var. sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis's henriettella, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring or early summer. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts.
